node.title: Summer sun sizzles Aotearoa: Lower Hutt, Invercargill crack 32 degrees
node.description: Summer has well and truly arrived, with Invercargill reaching 32.2 degrees today, though some places around Aotearoa may be a little too hot in the next few days.

node.title: US flight cancellations hit new holiday peak amid Covid-19 and bad weather
node.description: Flight cancellations in the US have hit a new peak in a Christmas season hit hard by the Covid-19 pandemic and bad weather.

node.title: Canadian Olympic boss "worried" if Winter Games can go ahead as planned
node.description: With just over a month until the Beijing Winter Olympics opening ceremony the CEO of the Canadian Olympic Committee (COC) said he is increasingly concerned if the Games can go ahead as planned.

node.title: The transformation of Lil Nas X
node.description: He had a hit with his breakout single "Old Town Road," about a horse-loving hip hop cowboy. But for his debut album, "Montero," the multiple-Grammy-nominee wrote songs about his real life as a gay man.

node.title: Hugh Jackman: The return of "The Music Man"
node.description: For the Tony-winner, who is appearing in the Broadway revival of the classic musical about a trombone-selling huckster, being a chronically nice guy is more than just an act.

node.title: Gen. Steve Anderson on January 6 and the "domestic cancer" threatening American democracy
node.description: The retired brigadier general reflects on defending our nation from all enemies, foreign and domestic, including those who attacked Congress and support Trump's "Big Lie," many of whom have ties to the U.S. military.

node.title: Jan. 6 investigator Jamie Raskin: "I'm not gonna see American democracy go down the tubes."
node.description: The Maryland Representative witnessed the attack on Congress by insurrectionists on January 6, 2021, but he'd already experienced an even darker day, when his 25-year-old son, Thomas, took his own life.

node.title: Poll: A year after Jan. 6, violence still seen threatening U.S. democracy
node.description: This is the first in a CBS News Elections and Polling series studying the state of democracy.

node.title: Betty White: A look back in laughter
node.description: Actress Betty White, star of such classic sitcoms as "The Mary Tyler Moore Show" and The Golden Girls," and winner of five primetime Emmy Awards, has died at the young age of 99. Correspondent Mo Rocca has a remembrance.

node.title: Artist Judy Chicago on making a name for herself
node.description: At 82, the founding mother of feminist art is being celebrated with her first career retrospective, at San Francisco's de Young Museum.

node.title: Powerball jackpot goes up to $522 million after no one wins top prize on New Year's Day
node.description: There was a $2 million winner in Maryland and three $1 million winners, one in Arizona, one in California and one in Florida, according to Powerbal's websiteâ€‹.

node.title: January 6, the "Big Lie," and the fate of democracy
node.description: Baseless allegations of election fraud amplified by Trump fueled the violent siege on the Capitol to overturn the will of America's voters; officials fear denying the results of elections is chipping away at the integrity of our democracy.

node.title: 'No final decision' but joining Auckland mayoral race 'unlikely' - David Shearer

node.title: Police have 'serious concerns' for missing woman
node.description: Police say they have 'serious concerns' for a 39-year-old woman who was last seen in the Queenstown area about midday on New Year's Eve.

node.title: Antarctic outpost hit by Covid-19 outbreak
node.description: A Belgian scientific research station in Antarctica is dealing with an outbreak of Covid-19, despite workers being fully vaccinated and based in one of the world's remotest regions.

node.title: Holiday road toll rises to 12: Fatal crash brings down power lines
node.description: Twelve people have died during this Christmas-New Year holiday road toll period, surpassing last year's total with three days to go.

node.title: Surf lifesavers ask public to stay safe and behave as drowning and misbehaviour mount
node.description: The problems aren't just in the water with Surf Life Saving reporting a steady flow of disorderly behaviour to police over the New Year period.

node.title: 'Bit of an addiction': Keen adventurer making fifth trip to remote island to find elusive shipwreck laden with gold coins
node.description: The General Grant passenger vessel is documented as having more than 2500 ounces of gold on board.
